titleStmt.title: An answer to the Quakers pretended charity above ingratitude; made manifest in their barbarous and unrighteous dealings in the case of Thomas Boyce of Horselydown in the county of Surrey, who had been one of them above ten years: and with the consent, and upon the earnest request of the said Thomas Boyce, published to the world.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: print show-through with some loss of text.
Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
